report_text: It stores the logged keystrokes in the following file: [CWD]\.tmp When the "EXECUTABLE_0" malware is executed it : Creates a copy of itself in the following locations: %APPDATA% %USERNAME% Tries to open the following file: [CWD]\Authorization.exe.config Entrenches in the system for persistence in the following registry locations: REGISTRY_0 REGISTRY_1 Beacons to the following C2 node IP:.

* over TCP port 1177:"IP_0” Makes the following modification to the registry to bypass the Windows Firewall: REGISTRY_0 The downloaded file is decoded, written to disk as %APPDATA%\...\ccSvcHst The following files created when the EXECUTABLE_0 malware executed: EXECUTABLE_1 EXECUTABLE_2 EXECUTABLE_3 and EXECUTABLE_4 are created by EXECUTABLE_5.
